article:
# Recipe: Crockpot Chicken Noodle Soup

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Crockpot Chicken Noodle Soup is a classic comfort food that is perfect for chilly days or when you're feeling under the weather. This recipe combines tender chicken, flavorful vegetables, and hearty noodles in a delicious broth. It's a one-pot meal that is easy to prepare and will warm your soul.

## Ingredients
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 8 cups chicken broth
- 3 carrots, peeled and sliced
- 3 celery stalks, sliced
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1 bay leaf
- 8 ounces egg noodles
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

## Equipment
- Crockpot or slow cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Measuring cups and spoons
- Wooden spoon or spatula

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 6-8 hours on low heat or 3-4 hours on high heat

## Steps
1. Place the chicken breasts in the crockpot.
2. Add the carrots, celery, onion, garlic, dried thyme, dried rosemary, and bay leaf to the crockpot.
3. Pour the chicken broth over the ingredients in the crockpot.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Cover the crockpot and cook on low heat for 6-8 hours or high heat for 3-4 hours, until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
6. Remove the chicken from the crockpot and shred it using two forks.
7. Return the shredded chicken to the crockpot.
8. Add the egg noodles to the crockpot and cook for an additional 30 minutes on high heat, or until the noodles are tender.
9. Remove the bay leaf from the soup.
10. Serve the Crockpot Chicken Noodle Soup hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the soup with crusty bread or crackers for a complete meal.
- Pair it with a side salad for a lighter option.
- Add a squeeze of lemon juice for a tangy twist.

## Variations
- Add frozen peas or corn for extra vegetables.
- Use whole wheat or gluten-free noodles for a healthier alternative.
- Substitute chicken thighs for the chicken breasts for a richer flavor.
- Add a splash of heavy cream or coconut milk for a creamy version of the soup.

## Tips and Tricks
- To save time, you can use pre-cooked rotisserie chicken instead of cooking the chicken breasts in the crockpot.
- If you prefer a thicker broth, mix 2 tablespoons of cornstarch with cold water and stir it into the soup during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
- Adjust the seasoning according to your taste preferences. You can add more herbs or spices if desired.
- Leftover soup can thicken in the refrigerator. Add a little extra chicken broth when reheating to thin it out.

## Nutritional Information
- Serving Size: 1 cup
- Calories: 200
- Fat: 4g
- Carbohydrates: 20g
- Protein: 20g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the soup on the stovetop or in the microwave until heated through.
- If the soup thickens upon refrigeration, add a little chicken broth or water when reheating to achieve the desired consistency.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I freeze the Crockpot Chicken Noodle Soup?
  - Yes, you can freeze the soup for up to 3 months. Make sure to cool it completely before transferring it to freezer-safe containers or bags.
- Can I use chicken thighs instead of chicken breasts?
  - Absolutely! Chicken thighs will add more flavor to the soup.
- Can I use homemade chicken broth instead of store-bought?
  - Yes, homemade chicken broth will enhance the flavor of the soup. Just make sure it's well-seasoned.
- Can I add other vegetables to the soup?
  - Of course! Feel free to add your favorite vegetables like peas, corn, or green beans.
- Can I use a different type of noodle?
  - Yes, you can use any type of noodle you prefer, such as spaghetti, fettuccine, or rice noodles. Adjust the cooking time accordingly.
